Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the list of notary nodes is in the source code

Author: TK#2921
Content: So after the notary nodes election, the source code is changed and all notes must upgrade. I suppose that the blocks from the nodes with the old notary nodes list are rejected. Am I right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: correct

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: though there will be at least 50% overlap

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if it is not in the latest list, it isnt a valid notary and cant be part of a valid notarization

Author: TK#2921
Content: Thanks for all your answers

Content: @gcharang i have just added it to Hush, it's in testing there. It has not been added to GAME/EMC2 yet. Currently only KMD + AC's have it

Content: Thanks duke. But it will be added to the external chains in the future?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gcharang that is the plan. it's not a consensus change, so coins can update and add dpowconfs, without a hardfork/etc

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Got it. there is going to be an article announcing this addition to KMD and ACs so wanted clarity about external chains

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gcharang Hush will be the first external dpow coin to get dpowconfs, then it will be easy to port that to other external coins

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yeah, you usually need 4GB of RAM to compile any Zcash fork

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: on startup does it display the pubkey is being used?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one of the first printouts it shows the PUBKEY.(....)

Author: beybietron#2493
Content: well let me actually set it to 4GB first before pasting my new errors, maybe it's memory related as well

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you can run a pre-compiled komodod with 2GB, but 4GB of swap/ram is usually needed to compile

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```Swap Space (Optional)
You will need at least 4GB of RAM to build hush from git source, OR you can enable a swap file. To enable a 4GB swap file on modern Linux distributions:

sudo fallocate -l 4G /swapfile
sudo chmod 600 /swapfile
sudo mkswap /swapfile
sudo swapon /swapfile```

Author: beybietron#2493
Content: Yup, set swap to 4GB, and it compiled
